page.title: 13LIFE STYLES IN MARSHFIELD
page.content: The distinct geographical and social community includes those whose roots go back centuries and newcomers who often choose to stay. The sense of identity found here along with the beauty of the countryside creates a friendly community where doors can be left unlocked. There are differences of income, class, age and sex that affect life styles, as does working in or out of the village. The majority of inhabitants lead peaceful lives and interact through a wide range of societies. The High Street when busy with shoppers, reflects a relaxed approach to dress, with the occasional high heel or green welly high-lighting opposite life styles. The young people anxious to assert their independence, parade in jeans, play pop music and manoeuvre with the opposite sex.
